Description:
Game-carrier (?) 


Double loop of fiber tied at one end, with large, round, wood beads threaded on it.
A necklace made of fiber string, teeth, copper wire, and seeds.
1 bundle of hemp as taken from the abaca plant.

1 large woven basketry hat ("Taming").  Made of fiber, wood, and metal.  Abstract design in tan and dark brown of diamonds and triangles.  Hat is round, shaped like a low cylinder, mildly curved on top.  Has a conical wood(?) piece attached on top with a metal fastening.  Inside of the hat it has a woven fiber, circular piece, possibly to situate hat on wearer's head.
A pair of elaborate bead earrings made with cork ear spools, glass beads, metal chain, shell, fiber, and string.
Curatorial Notes: Item is stored in a box.

Description:
One embroidered cotton woman's shirt. 


Lone long sleeved cotton shirt with red body and black sleeves.  Elaborately embroidered at neck, shoulders, collar, front, sides, bottom, and cuffs in red, black, yellow, and white geometric patterns.

One embroidered hemp woman's shirt.   


Small hemp shirt, loose weave, red body, with black sides and blue sleeves.  Embroidered with geometric patterns in yellow, white, red, and black cotton at collars, shoulders, cuffs, front, bottom, and sides.

One native skirt, similar to those worn by Manobo women. 

Pattern of stripes and abstract designs, mainly in red and brown, some green and yellow. 

Thick, coarse cloth. Shorter edges have hemmed finish. 


In box which contains: 8417, 8419a&b, 8389, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.
Curatorial Notes: Kept folded. Estimated complete length without entirely unfolding.

Description:
One blue and white pina and silk shirt.  Pina is a name for pineapple fiber of which this think cloth is made. 


Shirt made of thin fiber material -- pineapple fiber -- and silk.  The shirt has many narrow vertical stripes in white, cream, blue, and black.  It has a large collar and half length sleeves.
large sun hat

One native made shirt of piñapok cloth.  

Has red, blue and brown stripes.
Curatorial Notes:
Folded and tied with cotton thread to which the tag with the catalogue no. has been attached. Was unfolded

Said to be old.

In box which contains 8389. 8417, 8419a&b, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.

Description:
One sarong striped in bold colors: purple, yellow, green and black. 

Made of a long (164 * 182) piece of cloth (horizontally striped). Edges stitched together to form a sarong.
Curatorial Notes: Did not unfold entirely. Estimated complete length.

Description:
One embroidered bark coat. Has red embroidery on a brown (bark) background. 

Made by the Philippine natives from the inner bark of the paper mulberry tree and embroidered with European yarn. The trimmings are of (red) European, felt-like cloth. 

See also similar coat 8492.

One embroidered bark coat. Has red embroidery on a brown (bark) background. 

Made by the Philippine natives from the inner bark of the paper mulberry tree and embroidered with European yarn. The trimmings are of (red) European, felt-like cloth. 

See also similar coat 8492.
3 bundles of manila hemp fiber as it is "stripped from trees".
Curatorial Notes: Palo is a 3rd class municipality in the province of Leyte, Philippines

Description: An amulet of the Virgin Mary in cloth with fiber cordage.

One embroidered mesh-like pineapple fiber bridal Panuela (scarf). 

Two edges hemmed straight. Two have embroidered scalloped edges with stitching (blanket stitch?) and details in yellow and blue. One corner of the body has an intricately embroidered plant with flowers, leaves and stems. The flowers are made of little cotton rosettes in shades of pink. A few scattered rosettes and leaves also along a couple of the edges. 


Matches 8593.

One pineapple fiber camisa (blouse). Bridal, embroidered. Very fine, mesh-like, cream fabric. 

V-neck. Puffed, flared sleeves with embroidered scalloped edges in yellow and blue with details of rosettes. Ends of both sleeves have an intricately embroidered plant with stems, leaves and flowers. Flowers are cotton rosettes in shades of pink and white. A few leaves scattered on the rest of the blouse. 

Matches 8592.
Curatorial Notes: In box with 8591c.

Description:
One embroidered pineapple fiber (Piña) panuela (scarf).  

Made of a very fine mesh-like, light tan fabric. 

Two edges have a straight finish and two have scalloped edges with embroidered floral motifs in white along them. Scalloped edges have an attached decorative fringe of some sort of white cotton stitched fabric.

One pineapple fibre bodice and sleeves for camisa. Unfinished.  

Made of a very fine mesh-like light tan fabric. 

Embroidered scalloped neck and sleeves- white thread. Embroidered floral motifs at ends of sleeves in similar white thread.
Curatorial Notes:
Did not unfold. Metal pins used to attach tags with catalogue nos.

In a box with: 8591a&b, 8592, 8594, 8595, 8597, 8598, 17509b, 17510a&b, 25677, 25678.

Description:
One hemp- fiber panuela. Item is a for neck kerchief, called Abaca. 

Made of a very fine, mesh-like fabric which is brown with pink highlights. 

Two edges have a straight hemmed finish. Two have an irregular, decorative edge in a leaf-like pattern with pink cotton (?) thread embroidery finish.
Curatorial Notes:
Folded and pinned with a metal pin (which was removed). Did not unfold due to fragile condition.
Catalogue no. written on a cloth tag attached with metal pins.

In box which contains: 8417, 8419a&b, 8389, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.

Description:
One cream colored Panuela for wearing on the head, for church. Made of very fine, mesh-like Pineapple fiber.  

Square. 

Embroidered floral motifs in center and four corners in white thread.  

Scalloped edges with embroidered details- also in white thread.

One piece of silk cloth. Plain, cream color. 

Material called Seda, made from imported Chinese raw silk.
A fiber fan.
Woven coconut oil strainer cone shaped.

One native sun-shade hat.  Made of linear leaves, edges turned down, faced with bamboo.  Round hat of weaves, held together with fiber.  A small piece of pointed wood is set in the center.  The bottom has a rim of wood (bamboo?) and woven fiber.  The inside has a circle of wood (bamboo?)  to rest on head.  Also edged with fiber.  Has a long strap of black cotton.

One Moro sun shade hat.  Large sun shade.  Round with rim made of long wood rod bent into a circle.  Base of hat formed of leaves sewn into place with fiber (cotton?) string.  This is overlain with woven fiber (or bark) pieces forming geometric designs.  Wood rim wrapped with fiber at regular intervals.  Wooden knob at center.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: Coo5925
Number Type: original numbers
Description: Buri-palm rain cape.

Materials: Bamboo; Rattan; Cotton; Fiber; Animal bone
Description: One Igorrote hat, very small with bone ear-flaps.  Hat with flat top woven out of rattan in spiral pattern.  Long strip of bamboo wrapped around three times and painted red.  Fiber cord attached at opposite point forms chin strap.  Also at opposite sides ear flaps of carved bone into abstract shape attached with cotton string.
A fan made from wood and wood pulp with textile decorations.

1 hat, round, made of burgundy-red velvet and trimmed with embossed silver on the outside.  The velvet chin band has silver trimmings; the silver, very oxidized, is black.  Woven fiber ring on the interior.
Curatorial Notes: see also #25720. Cataloged twice.

Description: Fragments of cloth

Wide cone of woven blue bamboo fiber with paper peach and flower appliqués on outside in orange, red, green, and yellow.  Inside, a loop of bamboo fiber is lined with pink silk for fitting to head.  A cotton string is attached to this to use as a chin strap.
Curatorial Notes: catalog card says, "Turned in by V. Jones, June 1958"

Description: Wide cone of woven green bamboo fiber with appliqué paper flowers in yellow, red, and green.  Inside, a small circle of bamboo fiber is lined with pink silk to fit on the head.  A cotton chin strap is attached to this.
Curatorial Notes: catalog card says, "Turned in by V. Jones, June 1958"

Description: 2 dry pith from inside of bamboo
1 bundle of hemp fiber
1 lot-cloth fragments
large shell fragment with cord attached.  Yap money.

The object appears to be a tablecloth of white cloth with vertical striped of embroidered red/pink thread. General pattern of 4 strips, 2 stripes, 2 stripes, though interrupted where the cloth was sewn together. The long edges are bordered by horizontal pink stripes and alternating pink and yellow short tassels. The two middle strips were sewn together unevenly. Show fading, some dirt and stains.

Large white rectangular textile, hand woven. Made from 3 colors of coarse thread: dark brown, red-brown and beige. 


Mid-section patterning has large alternating bands of 3 dark brown and 4 beige. Dark brown bands are divided by two smaller bands of red-brown rimmed with beige. The long side is edged with brown-red bands. 


At either end of the textile are areas of plaid. The dark brown bands are crossed with faint beige lines and the beige areas have bands of diamond patterns created by the dark brown thread.

Small rectangular hand woven textile that is primarily navy but has alternating pink and white stripes all over it. To the right and the left equidistant from the center are two lines of an embroidered pattern. The pattern is of randomly alternating arrow-like notches of navy, pink and yellow.
Small long rectangular textile, tasseled on one side. Textile is navy with pink and yellow stripe pattern.

A large rectangular faded black textile with alternating red and white tassels on one end. There is a series of lengthwise red stripes (mostly pinstripes, but a couple with about a 2cm width). A few of the stripes are lined with white square 1 cm dots. There are some striped with a very small space between them which is filled with white 1 cm squares but most arc about 5 - 11cm apart. In four of the bigger spaces are designs consisting of white figures, white ladder shapes and white 1cm squares which form zigzag and triangular patterns.
Man's bark skirt. Many long bark strands hanging down from a waistband held together by fiber.

Small long rectangular textile with tassels on one edge. The textile is navy with pink and yellow patterning. Starting on one edge are 2 alternating stripes of pink and navy followed by a stripe of yellow, a red zigzag line and another yellow stripe. Next are three more stripes of navy, pink and yellow.

Long thin textile with tassels on the short ends. The textile is predominately navy with red, yellow and white stripes going lengthwise. On both short edges (running horizontal)  is a strip of navy and then a strip of red with a thin line of white down the center. On the inward side of the red strip is a wide stripe of navy. Following the navy strip is a wide red stripe outlined in white and two thin yellow lines. Closest to the tassels are two wide band of yellow with red dots.

Large rectangular tri-color banner.  Top is a large equilateral triangle pointed downwards with a piece of red and blue on two sides to create a rectangle.  Item is machine sown.  Written on white triangle are the words "KABINATAANG GALIWAG;" "DAYAN;" "MAGBANGON"

Large rectangular tapestry.  Brown background with red and tan pattern.  2 edges have an attached border with similar colors and short (1cm) red and tan tassels.  Tapestry is 4 pieces each 26cm wide stitched together, plus attached borders with tassels.  Various small snags and some dark stains, small holes, especially along stitching that holds the 4 sections together.  1 patch, 2 x 4cm.

Bag made of woven beige cloth with braided tassels sown on the bottom stripes of blue (3).  Blue with a red edge (1) and blue and red checkers (1) run horizontally.  Intersected by 3 stripes of red and yellow running vertically and diagonally along the front, and a single vertical line down the back.  The circular handle appears to be brass, with wrapped coils where it is attached to the bag.  Some of the tassels have frayed off and there is a small brown stain on the upper right side of the front. 


handle: 5" diam; bag: 7" wide at widest, 7 " long, tassels 10.5" long

Cloth bag (beige) with long fringe and metal loop handle (probably brass).  The handle is attached with coils.  The bag has 4 blue horizontal stripes and one blue and white checkered stripe.  There is a vertical yellow and red stripe running down the middle.  There is a 4.5 hole in the bottom of the bag, the fringe below is missing.  The cloth is stained with age.
A bundle of braided rope, coiled in loops.  Ready for basketry work.  Unknown fiber in brown, tan, and yellow.

Long rectangular plaid of a coarse thread--hand woven.   The pattern is made from 3 colors of thread: a dark brown, medium brown, and beige.  Mid-section is alternating bands of these colors, but the ends have both horizontal and vertical bonding to create an area of plaid.  Jute fiber textile.

Rectangular dark blue textile with red and yellow stripes.  Consists of 3 long sections stitched together in a red and yellow zigzag pattern.  Each end is trimmed with a tasseled border--on one end this border is sewn with brown thread against the textile so tassels hang in toward the center of the rectangle.  There are vertical sections of very faded blue cloth on either side of the textile.

Textile of strips of magenta, black, and green-patterned cloth, as well as a single strip of cloth with the entire magenta-yellow-green-black-green patterned motif in an unbroken, unsown pattern.  The entire length of cloth was sewn together at the long ends to create a cylinder that is open at both short ends.  The cloth is severely faded and the sewn strips are coming apart in 9 places--4 on one end--creating large holes.  The fabric is unfinished at both ends.

Wide rectangular textile--hand woven and of a very coarse thread (jute fabric).  Made of three color threads:  dark brown, medium brown, and beige.  Large alternating stripes of colors create the patterning of the mid-section, while either end of textile contain areas of plaid.  Sewn together from 4 strips.

Long rectangular textile--hand woven and made of a coarse thread (jute fiber).  3 color threads were used: red-brown, dark brown, and beige colors create a banding pattern on mid-section of textile, with areas of plaid on either end.

A large multicolored blanket--hand woven.  The textile is of white, blue, and red thread and has a semi-complex patterning.  The pattern is as follows:  On either side of the textile, length-wise, there is a 25cm wide area of navy.  On top of the navy, in the center, is a 2cm wide red strip flanked on either side by thinner red lines.  To the right is a 2cm loosely woven stripe of white, a thin red line, a 2cm wide area of navy, and another loosely woven white line this time flanked by two red lines.  To the left of the wide red stripe are three 2cm wide white stripes and three thin red lines that alternate.  On either end of the textile, width-wise, are 30 cm wide areas of blue and white patterning.  Along the edge is a 2cm wide navy border with a red line through the middle.  Next is a series of 9 blue bands created by the repetition of a diamond pattern on a white background.  The top part of this area is a band of small diamonds, 3 wide.  The center area is just white, but has 3 long stripes of blue that extend length-wise, and are evenly spaced.  The blue stripes have white lines down their centers--which are seams.  The textile is six strips of weaving sewn length-wise together.

Rectangular cloth made from 4 strips (2 pairs--2 with a slightly prominent pink stripe and 2 with a dominant blue stripe) sewn together with zigzags of yellow and red embroidery.  Also two strips sewn on the ends with horizontal stripes and short tassels of yellow and red.  The pattern is vertical stripes of alternating pink solid and blue triangle-diamond pattern.  The patterning is white thread.  There are also tassels at 2 opposing corners of the textile.

A large plaid rectangular textile--hand woven.  The piece is actually 202cm x 334cm, but is fold and machine sewn on the open side to create a piece half its original size.  Textile has thread of white, pink, lime green, navy blue, and yellow to create the plaid.  Pink, blue, and green are the dominant colors.  Yellow and white are accents.  Made of 2 separate pieces sewn together at the center.

Long rectangular piece of cloth--hand woven maybe.  Thread is a bit stiff.  Cloth is striped irregularly with fusia, mint green, navy, yellow, red-orange, grey, and white thread.  It is not finished on the short ends and therefore is fraying. 


Multi-colored striipes; the bright pink color is silk; remainder is of cotton

Large rectangular piece of cloth--could be hand woven.  Thread is particularly stiff and of many colors:  Fusia, navy blue, yellow, orange, mint green, white, and a light blue. 

The patterning of the piece can be divided into 4 sections of pattern, interspersed with three large areas of navy blue.  The patterned bands that edge the piece are identical, while the two interior ones are identical with each other.  The patterning is irregular bands of colors, some containing triangular and/or diamond patterns.

Long strip of textile--hand woven rough cotton.  Textile is predominantly black, but contains a long irregular striped band of red and white thread down the center.  Textile is tasseled on the short ends and is edged with red on the sort ends, as well.

Large rectangular jute fiber textile.  Probably hand woven.  It has lengthwise parallel red pinstripes about 9 cm apart covering entire textile.  There are 2 additional red stripes also lengthwise which are about 2 cm wide and lie about 1/4 of the way in from either edge.  The base color is a faded black.  Between the two innermost red stripes there is a design consisting of white figures and ladders (?) which are spaced with white dotted patterns of triangles and zigzag lines.  Similar square dots line the pinstripes nearest the wider red stripes and the pattern containing figures, ladders, and dots is repeated on the outer lengthwise edges.  On one end of the textile there are alternating white and red tassels.

Long, narrow rectangular textile.  Blue background with light red and yellow designs woven into cloth.  Design occupies center 30cm, both ends of the textile, and 2 stripes, approx. 2cm wide between center and ends.  Both ends are finished with tassels made of twisted blue thread tied to red and yellow thread.

Long rectangular textile.  Dark blue background with 3 red stripes along length of cloth.  The 2 smaller stripes (1cm width) have a thin yellow strip through their centers.  The middle red stripe is thicker (3.5cm) with 1 white, 2 yellow, and 2 red pinstripes on either side.  Approx. 10cm from one end is a red and yellow border in the same pattern as the border at the very edges of both ends.  Blue, red, and yellow tassels.

1 hat, "Kapok" fine weave 


Woven fiber hat with fiber ends left loose creating a fringe around the brim, which is slightly upturned.  Some fibers left loose around the top edge of the crown as well.

1 hat, Uway, fine weave. 


One hat made of woven fibers.  Either the hat is unfinished or the style is to have the crown be woven and the brim left unfinished so that it is fringe like.  The fibers of the brim are loosely woven and extend out like fringe.

1 Buntal hat, in the process of manufacture, crown only.  Very fine weave design.  Buri, Tagalog.  Woven from the fibers pulled out from the petiole of Corypha elata.  Has long bundle of fibers with a braided section at the one end. 


Bundle was measured.
A hat made of textile and cardboard.  Size 6 7/8

A black cloth belt with round shell.  Materials include textile, shell, rattan, enameled metal, and horn. 


Worn by the kadangyan (upper class)

A brown cloth belt with mother of pearl.  Materials include textile, shell, rattan, and horn. 


Worn by the kadangyan (upper class)

Conical fish trap.  Conical fish trap made of rattan with perforated metal base.  The sides are composed of vertical perforated metal base.  The sides are composed of vertical caning, bound by woven rattan.  Has a smaller basket with opening, set inside it.  It tapers to a narrow entrance with spikes so fish can get in but not out.

One scarf made of mesh like, Pina fibers. Pink in color and embroidered in cotton thread with pink flowers and decorated with plastic sequins. 

Square. Embroidered flowers on one corner and along two sides. Two of the sides have a straight, hemmed finish and two have an irregular, decorative finish with a castellated design. 


Has a matching jacket (17509b).
Curatorial Notes:
Labels attached with metal pins.

Associated jacket on same shelf but different box.

In box which contains: 8417, 8419a&b, 8389, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.

Description:
One jacket made of mesh like, Pina fibers. Pink in color and embroidered in cotton thread with pink flowers and decorated with plastic sequins. 


Pink jacket with embroidered (pink) flowers and abstract designs on both sleeves. Sleeves puffed and flared with embroidered edges in a castellated design. Front is open. 


Has a matching scarf (17509a).
Curatorial Notes:
Labels attached with metal pins.

Associated jacket on same shelf but different box.

In a box with: 8591a&b, 8592, 8594, 8595, 8597, 8598, 17509b,  17510a&b, 25677, 25678,

Description:
One jacket of light brown mesh-like Piña fiber with red, yellow, blue, black and white embroidered designs. 

Puffed sleeves. Front open. Embroidered scalloped edges in red, white, blue, yellow and black. Embroidered circular motifs (flowers) on the sleeves in the same colors. 


Has an associated scarf (17510b).
Curatorial Notes:
Did not unfold to measure due to fragility of the item.

In a box with: 8591a&b, 8592, 8594, 8595, 8597, 8598, 17509b, 17510a&b, 25677, 25678.

Description:
One scarf of light brown mesh-like Piña fiber with red, yellow, blue, black and white embroidered designs. 

Square. Two edges hemmed straight. Two with an embroidered finish in a scalloped design. A few embroidered circular motifs (flowers?) in two corners. 


Has an associated jacket (17510a).
Curatorial Notes:
Did not unfold to measure due to fragility of the item.


In a box with: 8591a&b, 8592, 8594, 8595, 8597, 8598, 17509b, 17510a&b, 25677, 25678.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: Coo6168
Number Type: original numbers
Description: lid.  Round lid for (a) made of woven rattan with rim of bamboo or other wood.  Two handles of rattan.  One has original tag to one handle with fiber cord.
A bracelet is made of black and white glass beads threaded on textile.
A bracelet made of glass beads on a fiber string.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 12
Number Type: original numbers
Description:
Hat with rain basket. 


The basket is a square pouch of pig skin. A long, thin flap covers the opening of the pouch and extends past the bottom of the basket. The flap has been partially folded in towards the center of the skin through which rattan cords have been tied. These cords served as a sling for the basket. The cords are bound by smaller cords to the top of a piece of wood has been sewn into the basket with a patch of some material. Partially lining the edge of the opening to the basket and the edges of the folded part of the flap is a strip of red cloth. 


The hat is constructed of a rattan frame to which skin has been sewn with several strips of rattan. The frame consists of thin and wide doubled-over pieces of rattan radiating out from the center. At the center where he open ends of the rattan pieces are, the pieces are woven together with small strips of rattan. At the edge of the hat the strips have been inserted through a circular piece of rattan and then through another piece that is tied to the first circular piece at one end, but sticks out and is squared off at the other. Thus the hat appears to have a small brim at the end where the two circular pieces of rattan are tied together, then becomes dome-shaped, and finally tapers off into a flat sheet where the frame is square-shaped. The hat is tied to the top of the basket with a rattan cord.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 20
Number Type: original numbers
Description:
This hat is covered with white cotton cloth on the top and green cotton (silk?) cloth underneath.  The brim is angled up to the crest.  The base of the crest of the hat is thicker than the rest of the crown.  There is a white button with 9 holes in a square pattern at the center of the crown of the hat. The inside of the crest is lined by a band of leather attached to the inside by a cotton cloth-covered, zig-zagging strip of wood which is stitched into the inside of the hat.  The rest of the interior is covered with white silk or cotton.  The what the inside of the hat is made of is unknown.  Also has a white cotton chin strap. 


A makers tag on the inside of the hat reads: "Alfredo Roensch, & Co. Manila & Iloilo"  A name is also written inside the hat that reads something like Mrs. H. E. smith.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 21
Number Type: original numbers
Materials: Animal bone; Iron; Wood; Rattan; Metal; Cotton
Description: The inside of this turtle shell hat has been lined with a piece of natural colored cotton cloth decorated with line drawings of flowers in brown.  This cloth is overlaid by wide strips of criss-crossing rattan which form a hexagon pattern.  These strips are secured to the rim of the hat by a piece of wood which has been nailed to the hat.  In the center of the hat,  a band of rattan for the wearers head has been secured to the hat by three interconnected loops of rattan which ring the band.  It has a chin strap attached to the inside made of linked metal rings (chain).  It is attached to the rattan by black cotton cord.  A length of white cotton cord is also attached to the chain.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 40
Number Type: original numbers
Description: The "bejuco" girdle is one long cord of intertwined strips of yellow and brown rattan which has been coiled in a number of loops. Made of bejuco fiber

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 41
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This is a very heavy cotton cloth bag.  It is made from a piece of cloth which has been doubled over and the ends sewn together, making a wide band of cloth.  The sides were stitched halfway up from the bottom, leaving an opening on either side of the bag.  Many long pieces of cord decorate the bag at its bottom. The cloth itself is decorated with blue strops and blue and red checkered stripes.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 43
Number Type: original numbers
Description: Turtle bag, This article is composed of three main pieces.  The first is the actual bag itself.  The bag is a skillfully carved, hollow rendition of a turtle shell.  The front of the turtle, including the head and front flippers, form a removable cover. The second part is the body of the turtle and that is the actual bag.  It's currently stuffed with some plant fiber mass.   A blue cotton cord attached to the body of the bag runs through the flipper portion to hold it together.  A cord also extends through a bone (or ivory) fish ornament.  Finally the blue cord attaches to a carved person (male) with long beard, long legs, and hands outstretched.  This figure is made of wood.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 45
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This rather small pouch is in the form of a miniature hammock.  This hammock is woven of cord. Alternating rows along the hammock have been painted black.  Along the edges of the hammock, green, yellow, and  red bits of cord have been tied at regular intervals.  There is a brass ring at each end of the hammock and a small plastic button just before that.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 55
Number Type: original numbers
Description:
This is a string of beads made of seeds.  Oblong gray and light brown beads in sets of two to five alternate with pairs of round, black beads.  The beads are linked by a thin piece of cord. 


Possibly either Bontoc or Negrito 


These string of beads could also be used wrapped around the women's hair for ceremonies.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 55
Number Type: original numbers
Description:
This is a string of beads made of seeds of light gray to light brown color and red color.  The gray to brown seeds are numerous and are rounded at one end and quickly narrow to a blunted tip at the other.  The red seeds are flat and rounded.  These seeds are strung in pairs. 


These string of beads could also be used wrapped around the women's hair for ceremonies.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 56
Number Type: original numbers
Materials: Brass; Hair/Fur; Shell; Cotton; Fiber; Animal bone
Description: This headdress is composed of a long loop of braided human hair.  All along its length, the braid has been banded with small, thin pieces of hammered brass.  The loop is held together by a string of cord, but the ends stretch for quite a length beyond this.  Right where the cords are tied together there is a dangling ornament made of a large crocodile tooth wrapped cotton string in pink, yellow, and blue, and just above that point are two cowrie shells.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 56
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This headdress is composed of beads and dogs teeth, strung along a piece of cord.  The beads are actually seeds with holes in them.  The seeds are tan to light gray in color and are rounded on one end and taper to a blunt point on the other end.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 57
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This long strip of tan (possibly faded to this color) and green woven cotton cloth is decorated at both ends with six parallel groups of 3 rows each of red stripes.  The breechcloth is worn by males over the age of 15 and is tucked under the girdle like an apron. Shorter edges not stitched. Small cardboard label associated with the item reads: "breechcloth".

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 57
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This is a long strip of red woven cloth decorated with 7 pairs of vertical white stripes and 16 horizontal rows of alternating yellow and blue patterning at both ends.  The very ends of the breechcloth have tassels of red and white.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 56
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This is a long strip of woven cloth.  It is decorated with alternating blue and green vertical columns, the green having a yellow stripe down their center and the blue containing specks of white.  The ends of t he cloth are decorated with tassels in the same colors as the cloth.

Other Numbers:
Other Number: 58
Number Type: original numbers
Description: This is a large cotton blanket.  It is white with large white, blue, and red stripes bordering the sides and three pairs of blue stripes running down the middle, paralleling the long sides of the blanket. Along the longer sides the broad band of blue, red, and white stripes are on a separate strip of cloth that has been attached to the body of the blanket. Along the shorter sides there is a broad band of blue with rows of small white dots - this band is part of or woven into the body. The short sides have a narrowstrip of cloth with vertical blue and white stripes. Four white and red tassels evenly spaced along top edge. This strip has been attached to the short sides such that it extends a few cenimeters into the longer sides.

Very long, thin textile of hand-woven white linen.  It is probably a table runner.  There are tassels at both ends as well as three stripes of red, green, and yellow at each end.  The cloth is quite thin and delicate.

Rectangular piece of cloth of heavy navy and white-striped pattern sewn together from three pieces.  Stripes are sewn together with pattern of alternating faded navy and red zigzag thread which is also stitched over the two short ends.  Each navy stripe has a thin red line in the center.

Small shirt made from beige/natural cotton.  There are 2 strips of cloth, each edged in dark blue, stitched together and folded over to create front and back of shirt.  Stitching is in red and blue thread with a zigzag design.

Large rectangular faded black textile with alternating 2 white and 2 red tassels on both ends.  A series of lengthwise white and red pinstripes (for the most part each stripe is a combination of a red and white stripe placed next to each other.)  There are 2 white pinstripes without red but with a series of square 1cm dots lining either side of them.  Also there are 2 red stripes with white dots lining them along with 2 wider (2cm) red stripes.  The spacing between stripes varies from 4 to 12 cm.  The larger spaces contain a design/pattern consisting of white figures and square 1 cm white dots which combine to form triangular shapes.

Long rectangular textile--hand woven, but machine sewed at ends.  Sift thread.  Multicolored striped patterning.  Colors are navy, fusia, yellow, green, slate blue, brown, and white.  A wide fusia stripe down the center has a striped line of yellow brown and beige.  On either side of fusia band are identical stripes containing smaller irregular stripes of all colors mentioned above.  On either side of center stripes are three navy stripes interspersed with multicolored stripes.

Long strip of fabric with tassels and a border at each end.  Main segment is dark blue, while borders are red, yellow, and blue.  Tassels are red and yellow thread on the ends of blue knotted and twisted thread.

Long strip of fabric with borders and tassels at each end.  Red background with 4 pairs of yellow lines.  Just before border on each end is a white and yellow zigzag pattern.  Border is a plaid pattern of yellow and blue.  Tassels are loose red and yellow threads.

Large rectangular textile--maybe hand woven.  Thread is stiff and of the following colors: fusia, navy, yellow, mint green, light blue, and white.  Mid section has a large band of fusia with a multi-color banded striped down the center and on either side.  The center band is flanked on either side by 3 solid navy stripes, alternating with 3 multi-colored bands of stripes.  The long sides are edged with wide bands of fusia.  One corner is folded and stitched.

Long rectangular cloth of six strips of blue and red-pink fabric.  The body is predominantly blue stripes (4 strips of fabric) and the ends are horizontal stripes of red-pink, blue, and white, that are slightly too long for the body.  The strips are sewn together with yellow and pink-red thread, which also comprises the tassels.  The tassels are sewn facing inward in one direction and outward in the other.  The end is stitched together on the side where the tassels face inward.  Signs of foreign deposits and insect damage.

Quiver made of multiple connected parts.  One end is a long, hollow tube, made of 1 piece of leather sewed together with fiber.  The other end is a rectangular pouch with one end left open and slightly rounded.  Arrow shafts insert into the tube end and points into the pouch end.  It is set up so that the shaft has to go in first, and only then can the point be pushed into the pouch.  This method keeps the arrows in the quiver.  A leather strap is attached to each part, and they are stitched together with cotton string.  The straps are attached to the tube and pouch with fiber cord.  Fiber string is also used to sew up the sides of the pouch.  The leather strap also has a tangled length of tan colored suede type leather wrapped around it.  The rest of the item is dark brown.
Curatorial Notes: location is noted as Philippines?

Description: One Moro barong (a), a small slash and thrust weapon, and scabbard (b).
One wavy kris (a) with a sheath (b).  The kris has a wooden grip with brass and wound cotton string decorations.  The sheath is wooden with wicker bands and metal accents.

Wooden sheath for spear head (37348a). Has same general shape, long, narrowing towards the distal end. However, it broadens out again at the very tip, creating a knob-like capped end. The main part was formed out of 2 identical pieces (so that the sheath is split down the middle). These pieces are lashed together by braided fiber. It narrowed a tiny bit at the opening. There is a small hole in the opening with some thin metal (copper?) wire through the hole.
Sheath for blade -- made to fit T-shaped blade.  Sides are curved. Made of wood, covered with fiber fabric, covered in turn by an unidentified black coating or pigment.
small bundle of fiber

One straight kris (a) and scabbard (b).  Kris has a handle wrapped with cotton and tipped with shell displaying a mother of pearl surface.  There is a multicolored, twisted silk scarf tied to the grip.  Sheath is wood held together with wicker bands.
Curatorial Notes: Captured from the Sultan of Pinud Gata, January 1, 1905

Materials: Wood; Leather (tanned); Mother of Pearl; Cotton; Fiber
Description:
2 inlaid slippers from the Philippine Islands (possible came from India?) 


More like a slip on heeled sandal than a slipper. 


The base is carved out of a single piece of wood with a raised heel and raised platform toe part.  The top of the wood is inlaid with mother of pearl.  A thick leather strap crosses over the toes.  The inside of the strap is leather, while the top is decorated with red cotton which is further decorated with fiber in geometric and flower patterns.  Sections of this decoration are yellow and probably all of it was this color once.  Cotton trim lines the edges.

Materials: Wood; Leather (tanned); Mother of Pearl; Cotton; Fiber
Description:
2 inlaid slippers from the Philippine Islands (possible came from India?) 


More like a slip on heeled sandal than a slipper. 


The base is carved out of a single piece of wood with a raised heel and raised platform toe part.  The top of the wood is inlaid with mother of pearl.  A thick leather strap crosses over the toes.  The inside of the strap is leather, while the top is decorated with red cotton which is further decorated with fiber in geometric and flower patterns.  Sections of this decoration are yellow and probably all of it was this color once.  Cotton trim lines the edges.

One of a pair of traditional wooden Japanese geta clogs or sandals.  Carved from a single piece of wood.  Two narrow platforms elevate the flat part of the shoe.  Thong attaches to front center and sides about 2/3 of the way down.  It connects on underside securing it to the shoe.  Thong appears to be textile wrapped fiber with green and white geometric patterns.  Fan shaped inlays of wood by toes and arrow fletching shaped inlays at heel.  Attached tag says "Nagasaki Japan"

One of a pair of traditional wooden Japanese geta clogs or sandals.  Carved from a single piece of wood.  Two narrow platforms elevate the flat part of the shoe.  Thong attaches to front center and sides about 2/3 of the way down.  It connects on underside securing it to the shoe.  Thong appears to be textile wrapped fiber with green and white geometric patterns.  Fan shaped inlays of wood by toes and arrow fletching shaped inlays at heel.  Attached tag says "Nagasaki Japan"
Moro fan, used for Dattoes or Headsmen; long curved bamboo handle.
Moro fan, used for Dattoes or Headsmen; long curved bamboo handle.
The wick piece for a glass lamp.
dagger scabbard

1 fighting spear and scabbard, captured at Dato Alis Fort Bernie, March 2, 1904. 


Sheath.  Slides over the metal head of A.  Made of two identical pieces of wood that, when placed together, form a complete sheath.  They are wider at the open end and taper at the closed end.  The two pieces are held together by a metal nail and a section of braided fiber near the narrow end.

1 bow, quiver, and arrows.  Bow and quiver used by mountain tribes and captured from them, Dec 20, 1904 near Perud Cata.  The heads of the arrows are poisoned. 


Long cylindrical cap for quiver (a) -- that fits on its open mouth and extends halfway down its length.  Made of woven rattan ending in a point at the top which is tied with fiber cord.  Entire item covered in an unknown, dark substance.
Wooden sheath wrapped in string
Curatorial Notes: Card lists origin as "Soeloe Islands" which could be Sulu Archipelago (part of the Philippines).  Record lists origin as Papua New Guinea

Description: A wooden rain hat.  Carved out of a single piece of wood.  Round with wide brim.  Tapers up at center of outside like a volcano.  B attaches here.  A cotton loop attaches to a small metal ring on inside.
Curatorial Notes: Only the wooden knob was located in the drawer.

Description: A fragment of a bead earring.  Made of brass chain, glass beads, shell, string, and wood ear spools.
A fragment of an earring made from string, glass beads and shell.
A fragment of an earring made from string, glass beads and shell.

One blue suit shirt (a) and pants (b).  Embroidered designs, property of chief or "Bagani" 


Shirt.  Blue long sleeved shirt elaborately embroidered at neck, shoulder, collar, front, bottom, sides, and cuffs in white, yellow, and red geometric patterns.

One blue suit shirt (a) and pants (b).  Embroidered designs, property of chief or "Bagani" 


Wide blue cotton pants.  Embroidered at bottom and lower sides in white, red, and yellow geometric patterns.
Top part of a small covered woven basket.  Fits on 8418b.

1 of 2 fragments of yellow cloth. Possibly cotton, bright yellow in color.  

Used as grave flags by Moros. 


In box which contains: 8417, 8419a&b, 8389, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.
Curatorial Notes: Kept folded. unfolded item. Catalogue number written on fabric tags attached with metal pins.

In box which contains: 8417, 8419a&b, 8389, 8485, 8492, 8493, 8538, 8596, 17509a.

Description: One wavy kris (a) and sheath (b).  Kris has a metal blade (rusty) and a wooden handle wound with fiber cord.

1 of 3 pineapple fiber (Piña) panuela, worn on the head, in church, by women. Very fine, mesh-like cream fabric. Embroidered with cotton (?) thread. 


Made of two pieces of fabric stitched together. Two edges left unstitched. Two have edges with a scalloped design and embroidery details in shades of brown and cream. Scalloping possibly left unfinished since the fabric extends beyond the scalloped edge.
Curatorial Notes:
Did not unfold to measure.
Tags with catalogue nos. attached with metal pins.

In a box with: 8591a&b, 8592, 8594, 8595, 8597, 8598, 17509b, 17510a&b, 25677, 25678.

One long piece of fabric. Three edges left unstitched. One has a scalloped edge with embroidery details in shades of brown and cream.

In a box with: 8592

Description:
1 bow string. 


Long thin bow string, made of a light, highly flexible wood that grows in segments (bamboo?), with each segment rising above the previous.  Slightly curved.  Segment of fiber tied around one end.  The other end winds back on itself several times, forming a complex knot.
Curatorial Notes: catalog  and card both originally note 1 strong, but then note that a 2nd string with this number was also found.  The two are currently tied together.

Description: Bowstring made of twisted fiber.  Long.  Firm, but highly flexible.  One end has extra fiber wrapped around it, possibly to keep it from unraveling.  The other end forms a loop, also covered with extra fiber, probably for attaching to a bow.
Curatorial Notes: catalog  and card both originally note 1 string, but then note that a 2nd string with this number was also found.  The two are currently tied together.

Description: A string of colored beads made from wood, bone and seeds, and threaded on fiber string.
A string of colored beads made from wood, bone and seeds, and threaded on fiber string.

Bowstring for bow (92175a). 

Made of a length of highly flexible wood, set in a curved shape. Both ends are wrapped completely in fiber. The fiber has loops on the end, so that it can be attached to the end of the bow.

Finely woven, tan colored, rattan in two rectangular pieces.  One inserts into the other; A into B.    


B is shaped like a flat pouch with one open end and one closed-rectangular, made of finely woven tan rattan.  Open end has braided design around rim.  


Fits on top of A, like a cap. Almost completely covers A.  Only a couple of cms. of base of A visible
